file_content.text: I am... no match. You... had the opening you needed to kill me... and yet you held back.
Your death would be a tragedy.
I do not wish to kill you.
Perhaps I'm just savoring the kill.
Maybe I'm toying with you.
I don't... I don't think so. I think I understand now.
Get it through your head--you can trust me.
Come to me.
Your actions reflect only light. You appear to be an agent of the dark side, but it's a mask.
It is a rude awakening to discover that all beings wear a mask. I expected it of you, a Sith.
But Master Karr also wears a mask. And his deception is a much... uglier one.
It's not his fault--his connection to the Force is flawed.
Forgive him.
The entire order is mired in falseness.
All Jedi are liars.
It's about time you figured it out.
Finally, you see the truth.
So... frustrating...! I cannot defeat you! It was... was it all lies? Everything?
He told me the light side was stronger--that it was why I could see through the facade of those who were dark.
But it's not true. I am no match for you. The dark side is clearly... stronger.
You haven't completed your training, Jaesa! When you have fully communed with the light side of the Force, no Sith will be your match!
Yet you are a Master of the light; why couldn't you beat me?
But I defeated you, Karr.
No one is interested in your lies anymore.
Shut up, Karr.
Someday, she may learn such strength. But not from you.
Perhaps.
All my life I've put up with deceit and denial. I thought the Jedi would be different.
You've shown me otherwise. You've exposed Master Karr for what he is. It's your power that reveals a person's true nature.
Your conviction and purity bring a reckoning that cannot be denied. I want that.
Join me, and from within the Sith Empire, we can forge a lasting peace.
Walk the light path with me.
Yes... I see the advantage of this. So much more can be achieved from within.
Your previous master was flawed, making you suspect. Do you think you can walk with me?
Are you up to it?
Please, give me a chance. I'll follow you, wherever it takes me.
Darth Baras expects you to die.
I'm supposed to kill you.
You--you can't do that. The dark side will claim you if you kill me. Please, let me join you.
The fear you inspire forces truth to the surface. I want that.
You will be my apprentice and I will teach you the ways of the dark side.
Join me in darkness.
I was sent here to kill you.
Too bad you must die.
Please, don't be foolish. I've just begun to taste the dark side. Let me and my special power serve you.
I believe there is a better way for you. Remain on the light path, Jaesa.
Don't embrace darkness.
I have experienced both sides of the Force. You should remain on your current path.
Don't embrace darkness.
Then I am to survive this encounter? I trust you--if remaining on the light path will serve you best, I embrace it.
Please. Let me stand at your side. I'll follow you, wherever it takes me.
Imagine having someone who can see through the deceptions of your rivals and enemies.
You are pretty handy with a lightsaber. Fine, I'll take you on.
True. And you can fight.
Thank you. And I can only improve with you as my mentor.
I'll convince my master that you've fallen to the dark side, and I will take you under my wing.
Fine. We'll fool Baras.
At last, I feel a sense of purpose. Something I can count on.
I will teach you the ways of the dark side.
You'll serve me well.
I am... honored, my lord.
I will not be questioned or challenged. Ever. Understand?
You better obey.
I will be yours to command.
What do you wish of me? And what shall we do with Master Karr?
Nomen Karr is insignificant. We shall leave him to his misery.
Nothing.
No... Jaesa swayed to the dark side. Sith, you have taken... everything from me. My life... has been... for naught.
Don't despair, Master Karr. You have existed to deliver me to my true calling.
Ahh... no... Jaesa, must you twist the knife?
I've never seen such a sad display.
Pathetic.
Can we please put this behind us, my lord?
This is a glorious day. Nomen Karr broken, and the dark side strengthened by your fall, Jaesa.
All the more sweet.
I feel your satisfaction. It... warms me.
He has turned away from the light. He needs guidance to heal and find his way back.
Send him to the Jedi Council.
Your wisdom is unrivaled, my lord.
Jaesa, I'll see to it the Jedi disavow you. You will be labeled an enemy of the order.
Then I'll finally know where I stand with you.
You took me as far as you were able. I hope this does not leave you bitter.
With the Council's help, perhaps he will come to understand.
Let's hope he can be healed.
My lord, I must speak up. Is it wise to allow such a powerful adversary to return to the enemy?
I will not be questioned, Quinn.
Know your place.
My apologies.
You are steadfast in your convictions--a rare quality.
There is more to this than you know.
I have my reasons.
Of course. I have faith in your judgments, my lord.
Allegiances can shift. Be sure you shift with them.
Enemies change, Captain.
I will remember that, my lord.
You inspire such loyalty and trust. That is very telling.
Nomen Karr will never understand.
He is blind to reality.
The galaxy awaits us.
Enough chatter.
Truth can cause the most painful wounds.
That must sting, huh, Jedi?
I wish him the best.
Your first act in my charge is to kill your former Master.
You must destroy him.
You want me to... kill him? I'm... conflicted about this.
I don't want you to kill him--I order you to kill him.
Do not question me.
Y--yes, my lord.
Karr will be delivered to Dromund Kaas, and my master will determine his fate.
Darth Baras will decide.
Isn't that... a death sentence?
Karr has fallen to the dark side. Baras will probably welcome him to the fold.
He belongs with the Sith now.
Ah, I see. He can be shaped into a force for darkness. You are so wise.
Is it wise to add his strength to the dark side? I mean, isn't it safer if he is....
We do not kill for the sake of it, Jaesa.
We must let him live.
We are beyond him now. He can do no further harm.
He poses no threat.
Perhaps it would be prudent to destroy him.
Good point, Jaesa. [Kill Karr]
No, Jaesa... this can't be... the end. I am your... Master....
My lord... I almost screamed out for you to stop. I feel chaos overtaking me. I'm... afraid of the tightrope we walk.
You will face constant uncertainty, and you must embrace the discomfort of it.
This is a difficult path.
I will try to make peace with my anxiety.
We must be strong, act with certainty and move on.
Get over it.
That will become my mantra.
Don't worry, I will guide you in this delicate path.
Put yourself in my hands.
I do find comfort in that.
To maintain our image among the Sith, we must sometimes make difficult sacrifices.
It's for the greater good.
I can see our journey will be a difficult one, my lord.
Even if you don't understand, believe that my reasoning is sound.
You have to trust me.
Yes, my lord. I defer to your wisdom.
Perhaps you don't have the stomach to do what is necessary.
Are you soft?
N--no, my lord, I'll prove myself to you.
We cannot concern ourselves with the plight of someone such as him.
He's beneath us.
I see. There is an attractive simplicity to that credo.
I'm actually feeling... excited at the prospect of killing him.
Jaesa, the Sith is turning you into a murderer!
It is for the greater good. A principle the Jedi often use to justify their actions, no?
It is done, my lord. Nomen Karr is no more.
Let the guilt of this--the exhilaration, the resentment--let it all nourish you.
Feel every feeling.
I've never witnessed a more devastated enemy.
A very satisfying kill.
My emotions are raw, but I have never felt so alive.
Many more Jedi will die at our hands.
This is just the beginning.
I cannot wait.
I have a taste for blood now. I look forward to indulging it with your next command.
I am ready to learn your ways, my lord. And I look forward to aiding you any way I am able.
No... no, this cannot be... my fate.
Who are you to preside over me...? You... you are... nothing. I am... I am Nomen... Karr....
